page.title: 02FARMING AROUND HINXWORTH
page.content: The land around is all agricultural; 2 large farms of 350 acres each and several small holdings of about 40 acres. Crops grown include: wheat, barley,oilseed rape and break crops of linseed, peas and beans. All work is done with machines:tractors,3 furrow reversible ploughs, harrows, sprayers and fertiliser spreaders; this cuts down the necessary work force to 2-3 men per large farm with extra at harvest time. Middle Farm has a large grain drier which also dries for other local farmers. The average working week before overtime is 40 hours from 7:30 am to 5pm with breaks for breakfast and lunch; the top craftsman's wage Grade 1 is just over Â£3 per hour although extra is paid for overtime. At harvest time a 90 hour week is not uncommon.
